disease: Malignant neoplasm of extrahepatic bile duct

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.severity: Variable, dependent on extent of biliary involvement

symptoms.name: Symptoms of cholecystitis
symptoms.pattern: Occurs in distal bile duct tumors due to Mirizzi's-like presentation

risk_factors: Congenital cystic changes (Caroli's disease, polycystic liver disease)

imaging_findings.CT: Essential for staging, localizes tumor, identifies nodal and distant metastasis, assesses local invasion, and identifies anatomical variations
imaging_findings.MR: Essential for staging, localizes tumor, identifies nodal and distant metastasis, assesses local invasion, and identifies anatomical variations
imaging_findings.Cholangiography: Used in preoperative assessment of resectability
imaging_findings.Choledochoscopy: Sometimes used in preoperative assessment of resectability
imaging_findings.Angiography: Sometimes used in preoperative assessment of resectability

required: Imaging findings consistent with extrahepatic bile duct cancer
Elevated CA 19-9 and abnormal liver function tests
supportive: Symptoms such as jaundice, diarrhea, weight loss, and fever
Risk factors such as primary sclerosing cholangitis or ulcerative colitis
